reviewText: These shows take me back to my childhood. Plus, I did not realize that each season has like 24  episodes, and I am not talking about an hour show that you only get 30 minutes of because of commerials, these are almost hour long episodes. Plus, it is just good TV. I will be buying the rest of the seasons also. Hard to believe how TV has changes since the 70's.

reviewText: i have watched all shows in first season 1 did see  some scratches in opening and closing of each show thats due to age of the film  the color was good sound was a little low need to turn tv up a little but still good to watch . watch a few shows in season 2 they played about the same . i don't know if any more restoreing  can be done on sound and picture its not that bad nice to see these old shows again

reviewText: I remember well when this series aired, and became a staple for family viewing. Later, in our family, we picked up on one of the trademarks that set the series apart from others; "Goodnight John Boy" was repeated often in our house, only substituted with real names. What it meant for us was a way to end our day, a kind of "don't let the sun go down on your anger" type of thing. We all can learn from the family unit that was "The Waltons." A true classic in television.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I loved the Walton's, but I missed the series originally and only saw it years later on reruns.  Then I would record them on the VCR and watch when I got home from work.  When the DVD's came out, it was like Christmas for me!  Each volume was so refreshing to watch.  I was born in 1945, and some of the years were before me, still it was fun to watch what life was like for my family.  My grandparents lived next door, so that to made it quite personal for me to see the grandparents actively involved in the lives of their grandchildren.
Title: N/A

reviewText: i remember watching these as a kid and it brings back good memories and good times. even though i did not live during that era i have always been struck by the kindness, compassion and real love of an entire family. most old shows i revisit never seem to be as good the second time around. but these are a treasure trove of a yesterday that i was not a part of and also brings back the memories of my life when this show aired. as i remember Earl Hamner saying it was a much simpler time and a house filled with love and joy. it is very relaxing to watch these in this time now and know that there were times in our country of difficulty and uncertainty but the love of family kept all things together. i was inspired by John Boy when i was young and wanted to be a writer. He is the true big brother we all wish we had.
summary: Good Old Days and a Loving Family
